{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3504874,"name":"Eren Orhun","username":"erenorhun","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erenorhun/{size}/203650_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T10:01:51.957Z","cooked":"

is it safe to use 25x50 with 3mm wall thickness iron on swerve chassis?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-07T10:01:51.957Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":580,"readers_count":579,"score":186.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":485531,"topic_slug":"iron-chassis","display_username":"Eren Orhun","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55838,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Excessive Loctite Enjoyer"},"post_url":"/t/iron-chassis/485531/1","custom_user_title":"Excessive Loctite Enjoyer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3504877,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T10:26:43.070Z","cooked":"

Iron is a less common material choice, but I’ve seen a few teams (ours included) substitute in steel or brass 1x2 inch (25.4x50.8 mm) solid bar on one side of the robot as a counterweight so it seems perfectly reasonable to use if that is what is available to you.

In what way were you concerned about it being unsafe?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-07T10:26:43.070Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":574,"readers_count":573,"score":119.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":485531,"topic_slug":"iron-chassis","display_username":"Domtech","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/iron-chassis/485531/2","custom_user_title":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3504885,"name":"Eren Orhun","username":"erenorhun","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erenorhun/{size}/203650_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T10:37:01.167Z","cooked":"
Domtech:

In what way were you concerned about it being unsafe?

bending or breaking, we have no problem with weight for now. we just want a chassis that’s durable

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-07T10:37:01.167Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":566,"readers_count":565,"score":133.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":485531,"topic_slug":"iron-chassis","display_username":"Eren Orhun","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55838,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Excessive Loctite Enjoyer"},"post_url":"/t/iron-chassis/485531/3","custom_user_title":"Excessive Loctite Enjoyer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3504926,"name":"Drakxii","username":"Drakxii","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T13:12:01.835Z","cooked":"

Really do your reseach on what steel alloy or type of iron you are going to use. Some common steel alloys and types of iron are weaker then the standard 6061 or 7075 aluminum.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-07T13:12:40.944Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":487,"readers_count":486,"score":117.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":485531,"topic_slug":"iron-chassis","display_username":"Drakxii","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23134,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2582/5941 Mentor, CSA, and RI "},"post_url":"/t/iron-chassis/485531/4","custom_user_title":"2582/5941 Mentor, CSA, and RI ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3504946,"name":"","username":"ProbablyWont","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e19adc/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T13:23:21.509Z","cooked":"

Fair, but also much different failure modes. Steel can take repeated bending while aluminum is generally more likely to catastrophically break.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-07T13:23:21.509Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":458,"readers_count":457,"score":106.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":485531,"topic_slug":"iron-chassis","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":23134,"username":"Drakxii","name":"Drakxii","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/4da419/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43037,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - 4253 Raid Zero / 8503 Raid One (Taiwan)"},"post_url":"/t/iron-chassis/485531/5","custom_user_title":"Mentor - 4253 Raid Zero / 8503 Raid One (Taiwan)","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3505041,"name":"Isaac Proctor","username":"Isaac-The-Pro","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/isaac-the-pro/{size}/265401_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T15:20:36.768Z","cooked":"

We usually use Aluminum 6061 2x1 tubing for our swerve chassis, and we’ve never had issues with it breaking. Iron or steel would be a lot heavier, and I don’t think any added strength would be very helpful. If weight isn’t an issue, and iron is what you have, then it should be fine, but I would recommend Aluminum

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-07T15:20:36.768Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":367,"readers_count":366,"score":98.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":485531,"topic_slug":"iron-chassis","display_username":"Isaac Proctor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"Regular","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6352 Scouting/Design Lead"},"post_url":"/t/iron-chassis/485531/6","custom_user_title":"6352 Scouting/Design Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3505172,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T17:28:31.093Z","cooked":"

There are caveats with using aluminum 2x1s. There are teams with reported and documented issues with pieces bending or snapping apart from hard hits. Some of this is due to the thickness of the walls of the extrusion. Some vendors like Rev offer light versions with thinner walls. Do NOT use those light versions for your chassis perimeter.

REV Robotics

MAXTube - 2x1

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 4

You can also add bracing down to a base plate or side to side to add rigidity. Making a large square that is attached at the corners only (which some teams seem to do) makes it much weaker in the middle specifically, but overall as well.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-07T17:30:08.704Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":289,"readers_count":288,"score":102.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":485531,"topic_slug":"iron-chassis","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/MAXTube-2x1/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"MAXTube - 2x1","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69147,"username":"Isaac-The-Pro","name":"Isaac Proctor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/isaac-the-pro/{size}/265401_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/iron-chassis/485531/7","custom_user_title":"Mr. Siefen","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3505183,"name":"Richard Wallace","username":"Richard_Wallace","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/richard_wallace/{size}/110760_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T17:42:11.058Z","cooked":"

Please have a look at Mark’s post in an earlier thread on this topic:

Aluminum or steel on chasis Technical Discussion
@Richard_Wallace referred to our steel chassis. Here’s what it looks like naked. It’s 4130 tube from this list. If you aren’t a welding team, this probably isn’t for you. I don’t think it can be riveted (citation needed). I’m not sure what your limitations are since you are outside the U.S. but, in my opinion, the 1x2 aluminum the is commonly used by most teams is the best bang for the buck.

The word “iron” is confusing us. I think you mean steel. The dimensions you listed is pretty heavy. Depending on how you’re using it, you shouldn’t have a strength problem, but a weight problem. Double check that you aren’t going overweight.

My daughter’s mentor had a steel frame that someone made and donated to the team, at least 2 decades ago now. He only used it to prop open the shop door.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-07T19:44:22.625Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":44.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":485531,"topic_slug":"iron-chassis","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55838,"username":"erenorhun","name":"Eren Orhun","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erenorhun/{size}/203650_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/iron-chassis/485531/12","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3505328,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T19:50:26.663Z","cooked":"

Steel will work just fine.
You will have a hard time finding steel weaker than 6061 T6!

Rectangular tube should be 46 to 50 ksi vs 36 ksi for 6061.

Nobody uses 7075 rectangular tubing. Or at least not more than one team!

Rivets just fine!

The main issue is weight. Followed by “do you have steel cutting tools”, which is a pretty small barrier

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-07T19:50:26.663Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":46.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":485531,"topic_slug":"iron-chassis","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/iron-chassis/485531/13","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3505856,"name":"Ege Saygılı","username":"Crystolyte","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crystolyte/{size}/233889_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-08T10:02:37.460Z","cooked":"

The Turkish aluminum industry is mainly architectural focused, so the materials produced reflect that, most sellers do not specify the alloy or the temper, since the applications are mostly cosmetic. Some sellers do specify the alloy (%99 6063) but the temper information is still not there, it is safe to assume every 25x50x2mm extrusion sold in Türkiye is 6063-T5 at best, that means approximately %40 less strength compared to FRC vendor extrusions (140MPa vs 240MPa), probably worse.

Regarding OP’s question, yes it makes sense to go with a steel chassis in my opinion, especially for a Turkish team, the main disadvantage being weight. I still think Turkish teams can continue using aluminum extrusions but design in a way that chassis rails are properly supported, also with this year’s game we will see much less full field accelerated impacts, plus no under the bumper intakes this year.
